page.title: 05RAF LYNEHAM TODAY
page.content: THE RE-SUPPLY OF THE FALKLANDS CONTINUES ON A DAILY BASIS WITH ONE HERCULES AIR-TO-AIR REFUELLED SORTIE FROM ASCENSION TO STANLEY. THE HERCULES HAS NOW BEEN MODIFIED AS A TANKER TO GIVE FUEL AS WELL AS RECEIVE IT AND SOME ARE BASED IN STANLEY WHILE OTHERS ARE AT ASCENSION. THIS RE-SUPPLY TASK STILL ABSORBS A LARGE PROPORTION OF THE STATION'S CAPACITY; NEVERTHELESS THE HERCULES HAS RETURNED TO ITS ORIGINAL ROLES OF FREIGHT AND PASSENGER FLYING AROUND THE WORLD AND PARACHUTE DROPPING, BOTH ROLES BEING OPERATED IN THE PURE MILITARY FORM AND FOR HUMANITARIAN PURPOSES WHEN NATURAL DISASTERS OCCUR. THE STATION HAS DEMONSTRATED ONCE AGAIN THAT IT IS ALWAYS READY TO RESPOND TO ITS MOTTO "SUPPORT, SAVE, SUPPLY".
